Method Detail

displayURL

public static void displayURL(java.lang.String url)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Display a file in the browser. If you want to display a file, you must include the absolute path name.

Possible security issue: if the url is received from a third party company such as Paynet, the url must be verified by the application before calling displayURL. Else it is possible for the third party company to send an url like "notepad.exe" which directly starts the exe without further asking the user of the application. Another attack could be the direct execution of javascript with a javascript url such as javascript:alert("demo"). The verification could just check if the url starts with "https://" (or "http://" if that is allowed).

Parameters:
url - the file's url. The url should start with either "http://", "https://" or "file://" but this is not enforced by Bogatyr. On windows the length of the url is limited to about 260 characters.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
